pathAssistantSteps.info:
Lead verification teams: There are a few reasons to disqualify a Lead, including if the customer needs have been captured and the customer does not meet the contract criteria.


To disqualify a Lead:

  • Change the lead status to “disqualified” (you this guide for additional help)
  • Select the closest option for the disqualified reason
  • Change the owner of the Lead to “Closed leads”


Sales teams: Before you disqualify a Lead:

  • Try to contact the customer 3 times over 2 separate days within 48 h you receive the Lead
  • If you cannot contact the customer, please send them an email with your contact details

Lead verification teams: Use the Customer Needs feature to capture:

  • How we can help the customer and their specific needs
  • Our categories of services and products that may address the customer’s needs (use this guide for product information)


Advise the customer that an account manager will contact them within 48 h


Sales teams: If this lead is from a customer you already manage:

  • Try to contact them 3 times over 2 days within 48 h you receive the lead
  • If you cannot contact the customer, send them an email with your contact details and disqualify the Lead
  • If the Lead contains products you are not familiar with, convert the Lead to an Opportunity and contact the Product Specialists team for assistance

The following information should be captured about the customer:

  • Name, phone number, email, address and preferred contact method
  • Organisation name, ABN, website address


Based on your conversation with the customer, use the guided qualification process to capture:

  • The customer's current business operations
  • How Australia Post can help them
  • Products that may address the customer’s needs (use this guide for product information)

• Before contacting the customer, check the information already captured in the Customer Needs section of the Lead
  • Try to contact the customer 3 times over 2 separate days within 48 h you received the Lead
  • If you cannot contact the customer, please send the customer an email with your details before you disqualify the Lead
  • If the Lead contains niche products you may not be familiar with, convert the Lead to an Opportunity and reach out to the Product Specialists team for assistance
  • Before you convert the Lead to an Opportunity, make sure the Lead record contains accurate data
  • If the Lead is for a customer we already have a record for, make sure you select “Choose Existing” in the “Convert Lead” window to select an existing Organisation and/or Contact record to avoid the creation of duplicate records
